headline: WORST COMPANY TO EVER WORK WITH
pros: There are no pros. Only cons.
cons:
The CRM team of this company is treated like trash. No one cares how hard you work or what you go through everyday at work. Team leaders and managers chill while the agents take back to back calls without a single second gap in between two calls. Not only this, AGENTS CANT EVEN DECIDE WHEN THEY WANT TO TAKE THEIR LUNCH OR TEA BREAK. You can only leave your seat when you are asked to. There have been days when agents even take their lunch breaks at 5 pm because nobody cares. The pressure that agents go through every minute of the day cannot be described. They have 2-3 designated so called SPOCS who will keep on pinging you to move to next call when it’s only been 4 seconds since the previous call ended. Not only this, they’ll poke you even if you go to washroom!! They’ll highlight it in group chats and different channels. It’s like working as a daily wage worker or worse than that. The team leaders and managers have absolutely no time to connect with the agents. Lol I don’t even know who exactly my manager was. They have no time to address the issues faced by agents while working. They’ll highlight if you’re even one second late in logging in but they’ll make you work post your shift timings because there’s business requirement. The irony!

I can go on for a thousand more words and it would still not be enough. Imagine having to justify to your team leader or SPOC, why you spent 5 mins in the washroom or waiting till 5pm for your lunch break because your SPOC hasn’t given you the permission to eat yet. They’ll change your shift timings any time they want, they’ll make you do whatever work they want. Why? Because they are paying you :)

headline: Experience at Grofers India Pvt. Ltd
pros:
I was given an internship opportunity with Grofers India Pvt. Ltd. in August 2017, which was converted to a full-time career opportunity in April 2018.
Grofers provides you with a work environment which is collaborative and learning. The managers give you immense accountability on projects and initiatives which will help you grow in a multidimensional way. 
Skills like stakeholder management, planning, execution are a few areas where one understands the non-linearity of learning.

It is a dynamic and challenging place which enhances your skills and focus on results. The average age of the organization is less than 28 years making it agile and quick in decision making, thereby, showing impact which usually takes months to be visible in multinationals.

All in all, I would like to sum the environment as:

1. Challenging
2. Learning Experience
3. Accountability
cons:
1. No Work from Home policy. 
2. Long working hours
3. Less equipped with digital portals

headline: Shaping retail industry in India with technology
pros:
I joined Grofers within two weeks since they started working on the consumer product. Now it’s been more than two years since I’m working at Grofers. Being my first company I wouldn’t be able to compare things to other companies out there but I can tell what I like about Grofers and what I don’t.

Being a young startup, you get to work on latest technologies which are popular around the world (Elasticsearch, AWS, Docker, Ansible, Python/Django/Flask, Redis, Postgres, MongoDB, Kafka, ReactJS) and do a lot of experiments, which provides ample amount of learning opportunities.
Startup environment, everyone around you is highly motivated to accomplish their goals.
It gives you competitive market salary and cool gadgets.
People around you are smart and helpful, they help you solve problems so you can focus on work.
If you have got idea(s), suggestion(s) or complaint(s) you can find founders very approachable and they do listen to your ideas. 
Many of the tools and technologies we use at Grofers are open source software and developers at Grofers believes in contributing to open source.
cons: Sometimes you have to work around the clock still, it doesn’t feel as bad as it sounds when you are building something you take pride in.

headline: Great technical team to work with
pros: Great team to work with. Most of the team is skilled with excellent technical know-how in their specialized areas be it infrastructure, backend, web or mobile development. Many of the team members are expert in more than one area, and they get better each day working on different kinds of projects, hence one gets to contribute to the product in diverse ways. Everyone is passionate about what they do and the overall goal of the organization which makes up a good working culture. As the teams are small, individual ownership is high and so is the impact that an engineer makes on the product on day to day basis.
cons: Except that there is no good coffee machine in the office premises, there is not much to complain about. There is some legacy tech stack but thats going away quickly.

headline: I have been working at Grofers full-time for almost 2 years

headline: Poorly Managed
pros: Company was good till last year - get to work hands on new challenges.
cons:
Nothing works now. There are so many resources to do same work. You don't enjoy work anymore. 10 people would be doing same task and would try and please the head framing stories about criticality of their job.
Apart from work, there are several other downsides:
1.No culture - people are treated as labours. No one would value you or your work. Everyone is considered replaceable.
2.Work timings - It is mandatory to come to office Mon to Sat; 9 am to 7pm. One they violate labour laws; second it is pure waste of effort. Even if you don't have work, be present in office and kill time. No public holidays. No over-time. No other benefit apart from your compensation, which again will increase by pennies understanding the cost pressure.
3.No communication/transparency - Founders hardly interact with people in organisation whereas this shouldn't be the case with a start-up. They are inapproachable. One sits with tech and is worried about tech issues; the other is mainly driving operations.
4.Incompetent management - Most of the head of departments do not have domain understanding. They are either the batch mates of the founders or 1-2 years experienced foreign degree holders. No process understanding. Being founders batch mates - no pressure for cost optimization or driving change. Organisation is being managed by one downs who fail to drive change as the head of departments can't convince the founders. Such heads have no accountability and if things go wrong, team members are fired on the spot and the heads meekly hide their faces. If you analyze grofers top-management, you would realize that there is no single name that has industry/domain expertise. The ones hired left the organisation in less than a year. 
5.No values - The head of departments run the organisation in an autocratic way. There are heads who use abusive language on the floor, shouts on team members and threatens them to take their job away if work is not done in their prescribed manner. Founders turn deaf and blind when this happens.
6.No professionalism -  Rules are different for different departments and individuals as well. Some has liberty to come by 10 and leave by 4 pm; work from home; attend dance/ zumba classes whereas others are penalized even if they reach by 9:30 am. No support to employees – no cab facility even if you leave at 10:00 pm.
